item.title: Positive Definite
item.description: \forall \vec{x}\ x^T A x > 0, then A is Positive Definite.

item.title: Positive Semidefinite
item.description: \forall \vec{x}\ x^T A x \geq 0, then A is Positive Semidefinite.

item.title: QR Factorization
item.description: For any m \times n matrix A, with linearly independent columns: A = QR Q is m x n its columns are an orthonormal basis for Col A R is n x n upper triangular positive diagonal ||\vec{r}_j|| ...

item.title: Quadratic Form
item.description: Change of variable Positive Definite Positive Semidefinite Negative Definite Negative Semidefinite.

item.title: Singular Value Decomposition
item.description: www.youtube.com/watch Applications If A is a invertible square matrix then the condition number is the largest singular value divided by the smallest singular value Condition ...

item.title: Spectral Decomposition
item.description: www.youtube.com/watch Symmetric Recall: If P is an orthogonal n × n matrix, then P −1 = P T , which implies A = PDP^T is diagonalizable and symmetric.

item.title: Symmetric Matrix
item.description: Definition Matrix A is symmetric if A^T = A The eigenspaces of a symmetric matrix are orthogonal.

item.title: Orthogonal Basis
item.description: A basis where each vector is orthogonal to to every other vector. Let W be a subspace of \mathbb{R}^n and has an orthogonal basis formed by vectors: \vec{u_1}, ..

item.title: Orthogonal Complement
item.description: The orthogonal compliment to a subspace W is the the set of all vectors that are orthogonal to W. i.e. W^{\perp} = \forall(\vec{y} \in W)\{\vec{x} \mid \vec{x} \cdot \vec{y} = 0\}.

item.title: Orthogonal Decomposition
item.description: I proceed to define the orthogonal decomposition for some vector y, where y \in \mathbb{R}^n, where W is a subspace of \mathbb{R}^n, where W^{\perp} is the Orthogonal Complement ...
